Key Match Events: India beat Afghanistan by 47 runs in the T20 World Cup 2024 Super Eight match.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 53 runs off 28 balls.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 7 runs.
Rashid Khan took 3 wickets for 26 runs.
Arshdeep Singh picked up the wicket of Noor Ahmad on the last ball of the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma praised the team's adaptability and highlighted the importance of key partnerships and smart use of bowlers.
Rashid Khan reflected on Afghanistan's performance, emphasizing the need for smarter execution and his own bowling form.
Suryakumar Yadav attributed his success to hard work, practice, and a clear routine.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's bowlers dismissed Afghanistan's openers early in the powerplay, preventing any significant partnerships.
The match was played at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, which will also host the World Cup final.
